instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, won't boot
threads.message:
Both USB-C Ports getting 20v, but 0.1amp. 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 13.01v 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 3.3v

I haven't touched these at all yet... power rail listings are new and scary :( 

Every liquid indicator on this thing is red, but there isn't actually any corrosion I can find. I do believe the customer cleaned it up. He said he was "looking at replacing the keyboard", and "accidentally touched metal on the board, shorting it out. Now it won't turn on". So... sounds like the unit used to work until the customer fucked with it. 

I thank you for spoon feeding me in advance...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Liquid damage, won't boot
threads.message:
Post diode mode to ground on all big coils.
Better to switch to ohm scale for CPU coils; very low values expected as normal.

Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>?
